title: Alaska to Count Sooner, as Write-In Leads
description: ANCHORAGE  Even as Senator Lisa Murkowski of Alaska appeared to be ahead by a commanding margin as a write-in candidate for re-election, her leading opponent said he was optimistic that he would ultimately win. Amid the mixed signals and expectations of a legal fight, elections officials announced they would begin manually verifying write-in votes next week, sooner than they had initially planned.

title: Stoked
description: I grew up without a fireplace because my neurotic (but fabulous) parents were afraid of fire. So Ive always been obsessed with them. In the house we built on Shelter Island, I put a bright orange vintage Preway in the bedroom. I had to search far and wide, and finally found the right one on Craigslist. The Preway is no longer in production, but you can still get free-standing fireplaces from Malm, a company out in Santa Rosa, Calif., that has been making them with great proportions and clean lines since the 1960s. (The one above is available from Design Within Reach.) When I am making a piece of pottery, I know that its finished  and that its good  if it looks like its supposed to be that way, like its been uncovered rather than created. To me, thats a Malm fireplace. And I like that its democratic, not precious. At its height of popularity, you were as likely to see one in a mobile home as you were in a groovy modernist manse. Those who dismiss these beauties as a bit of 70s nostalgia need to look again. Im never happier than when I lie in bed and stare at my Preway, a glowing beacon of orange optimism in the corner of the room.

title: British Agency Says Google Violated Privacy Law
description: PARIS  British data protection officials said Wednesday that Google had committed a significant breach of privacy laws when its Street View mapping service gathered e-mail messages, computer passwords and other personal information without the owners knowledge.

title: Taylor Swifts Speak Now Surges in First Week
description: When Taylor Swift released her latest album last week, everyone in the music business  and in pretty much every other business  knew it was going to be a success, but no one knew just how big. Now they have their answer: it is the fastest-selling new album in five years.

title: Houlihan Lokey Hires a London M.&A. Banker
description: Houlihan Lokey, the middle-market investment bank, said on Wednesday that it had made an addition to its deal-making team in London, bringing in David Sola as managing director.

title: In New York, Cuomo Wins Easily
description: Andrew M. Cuomo, whose career in government appeared all but over just eight years ago, began preparing to take control of New Yorks beleaguered state government on Wednesday after Democrats swept the four statewide offices.

title: The Real Threat to Science in the New Political Climate
description: A Dot Earth reader, J. Connors, reacted to my piece on the post-election prospect for hostile hearings on climate science by posting a spot-on comment about the real threat to such science in the new political climate:

title: Palin Proves That Mama Grizzly Has Bite
description: If former Gov. Sarah Palin of Alaska decides to run for president in 2012, she will now have plenty of help.

title: For Jumpy Gulf Residents, a Trust Gap on Oil
description: In Wednesdays paper, my colleague Campbell Robertson and I report on lingering skepticism along the Gulf Coast over the credibility of scientific and government assessments of the continuing threat posed by the BP oil spill.

title: Pornotopia
description: The disturbing world of pornography where women get what they deserve and the guys never have to be tested, or face rejection.

title: Bennet Declares Victory in Colorado Senate Race
description: 5:21 p.m. | Updated  DENVER  Senator Michael Bennet, a Democrat who only a few weeks ago was given little chance of retaining his seat, claimed victory Wednesday afternoon in his hard-fought race against Ken Buck, a county prosecutor backed by Tea Party groups.

title: Republicans Appear on the Verge of at Least Sharing Control of the New York Senate
description: On an otherwise largely disappointing night for New York Republicans, the party appeared to be on the verge of either retaking the State Senate or throwing the chamber into a tie, but three key races were too close to call Wednesday morning.

title: The TV Watch: A Night of Politics and Dancing
description: Tuesdays midterm election was hardly the first time that a political party in power has been rebuked and rebuffed two years into office. But its hard to think of another election night when politics and show business so oddly dovetailed, Alessandra Stanley writes. While Ms. Palin gloated over Tea Party victories on Fox News, her daughter Bristol floated across the stage of Dancing With the Stars.  Read more on The Caucus.

title: Wednesday Reading: The Caribbean on a Budget
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

title: House G.O.P. Leaders to Target Spending and Health Care Law
description: Top House Republicans, triumphant from their sweeping Election Night victory, returned to Capitol Hill on Wednesday morning to declare that they would begin laying the groundwork for spending cuts and repeal of President Obamas landmark health care bill.

title: Despite Soros, Prop. 19 Fails in California
description: It may have had the backing of one of the richest hedge fund magnates, but the California ballot initiative proposing the legalization of marijuana was rejected at the polls on Tuesday.

title: Toyota Retrofits 2.2 Million Vehicles With Smart Pedals
description: So far Toyota has retrofitted almost 2.2 million of its older vehicles with its Smart Stop system, designed under some circumstances to override the gas pedal and cut power to the engine. The automaker announced the system as part of its effort to deal with unintended acceleration concerns.

title: Really? Will These Ads Sell Me a Phone?
description: Help me out. Ive been watching the new Microsoft Windows Phone 7 ads on TV. They are very funny.

title: Malloy Declared Winner Over Foley for Connecticut Governor
description: The top election official in Connecticut declared on Wednesday that Dannel P. Malloy, a former Democratic mayor of Stamford, had edged Thomas C. Foley, a Republican financier, in the battle to become the states next governor.

title: MGM Files for Bankruptcy Protection
description: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, the beleaguered film studio, filed for bankruptcy protection on Wednesday as part of a reorganization plan that would help it shed more than $4 billion in debt and hand control over to a group of hedge fund creditors.

title: Mme. Curie Is Dead; Martyr to Science
description: PARIS, July 4.--Mme. Marie Curie, whose work alone and with her husband on radium and radiology has been one of the greatest glories of modern science, died at 6 o'clock this morning in a sanitarium near Sallanches in Upper Savoy. Her death, which was caused by a form of pernicious anemia, was hastened by what her physicians termed "a long accumulation of radiations" which affected the bones and prevented her from reacting normally to the disease.

title: Bolsheviki Seize State Buildings, Defying Kerensky
description: Petrograd, Nov. 7--An armed naval detachment, under orders of the Maximalist Revolutionary Committee, has occupied the offices of the official Petrograd Telegraph Agency. The Maximalists also occupied the Central Telegraph office, the State Bank and Marin Palace, where the Preliminary Parliament had suspended its proceedings in view of the situation.

title: Were Back. And Theres Plenty Still Unknown.
description: Yes, its Wednesday, the day after, yet theres plenty that we dont yet know.

title: Miss Mitchell, 49, Dead of Injuries
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 16--Margaret Mitchell, author of "Gone With the Wind," died today at Grady Hospital of injuries received when she was struck down by a speeding automobile on Peachtree Street last Thursday.

title: Kennedy's Victory Won By Close Margin; He Promises Fight For World Freedom; Eisenhower Offers 'Orderly Transition'
description: Senator John F. Kennedy of Massachusetts finally won the 1960 Presidential election from Vice President Nixon by the astonishing margin of less than two votes per voting precinct.

title: In Memoir, Bush Strikes Back at Kanye West
description: Kanye West probably shouldnt look for an invitation to any of former President George W. Bushs coming book parties.

title: Case Study Follow-Up: Did Fikes Pick the Right No. 2?
description: Last week, we published a case study that explored the staffing challenges faced by Fikes Products, a growing janitorial supplies and services retailer based in Kent, Wash., that has a history of making disappointing hires.

title: You Will Regret Reading This
description: Two weeks ago, Christine Haughney of City Room asked readers to tell us about any financial decisions of recent years that they would like to undo. We received so many comments that we ran a bunch in a post. But then that post generated a whole new set of comments. This time, for reasons unclear to us, readers expanded their regrets beyond the financial sphere  in many cases far, far beyond it. We now give you a selection, lightly edited. Warning: You may have nightmares. It is a coincidence that we are running this on the day after an election.

title: Show Us Your City: Architecture in Salem, Mass.
description: We asked readers to give us the local point of view by submitting a short travel video that shows why their city, town or neighborhood is amazing. This week, Katie Hutchison, a residential architect in Salem, Mass., shares her favorite local architectural highlights (plus a bonus edible highlight).

title: Bill Clinton Wishes Lil Wayne a Good Life After Jail
description: Among those who are looking forward to the rapper Lil Waynes scheduled release on Thursday from Rikers Island  besides his family, friends and the music industry, of course  is former President Bill Clinton. In an interview Tuesday with the Pittsburgh radio station 96.1 FM, Mr. Clinton said he hoped Lil Wayne would go on to lead a good life and set an example for his fans and his peers.

title: Laura Catena Uncorks Argentina
description: Eight years ago, Laura Catena got the notion to write a book about Argentine wine. Who better to do it? As the daughter of Nicolas Catena, Argentinas most celebrated winemaker, she grew up watching Mendozas wine culture evolve from run-of-the-mill jug wines to globally revered malbecs. Her father was the prime mover in that development, an economist by training who fell in love with Napa and became determined to bring a new level of ambition and expertise to his familys Mendoza vineyards, first planted in 1902. But the younger Catena, now 43, had little idea that telling this story would consume so much time.

title: Bowled Over by a Wave Election
description: Across the country, Democrats gave one concession speech after another. Here's the story behind one of them, by Representative John Boccieri of Ohio.

title: Richard Burton, 58, is Dead; Rakish Stage and Screen Star
description: Richard Burton, a Welsh coal miner's son whose celebrity was defined as much by his rakish personal life as his remarkable acting skills, died of a cerebral hemorrhage yesterday in Switzerland. He was 58 years old.

title: TRIBUTE TO VIETNAM DEAD: WORDS, A WALL
description: Washington, Nov. 10 -- President Reagan stopped by the National Cathedral to listen for a while to the reading of the names of the Vietnam war dead this evening.

title: Sink Concedes in Florida Governors Race
description: MIAMI  Alex Sink, Floridas Democratic candidate for governor, conceded defeat this morning after a marathon vote count that gave the Republican Rick Scott a razor-thin victory.

title: Charting Empires With an Assist From a Comic King
description: THE Temple of Dendur is hardly the first place youd go to see comedians work on their material. But on a Tuesday afternoon in October, Jerry Seinfeld and Colin Quinn were sitting in the Metropolitan Museum of Art near that Egyptian shrine to make a point about transience  if not of empires, then of jokes.

title: Nets Sponsor Enters the Locker Room
description: Just when you thought there was no more real estate left for sports teams to sell to corporate sponsors, the Nets have found yet another location: their locker room.

title: Armistice Signed, End Of The War! Berlin Seized By Revolutionists; New Chancellor Begs For Order
description: Washington, Monday, Nov. 11, 2:48 A.M.--The armistice between Germany, on the one hand, and the allied Governments and the United States, on the other, has been signed.

title: Patton's Career A Brilliant One
description: Gen. George Smith Patton Jr. was one of the most brilliant soldiers in American history. Audacious, unorthodox and inspiring, he led his troops to great victories in North Africa, Sicily and on the Western Front. Nazi generals admitted that of all American field commanders he was the one they most feared. To Americans he was a worthy successor of such hardbitten cavalrymen as Philip Sheridan, J. E. B. Stuart and Nathan Bedford Forrest.

title: Underneath a New-Fangled Election, Some Ancient Forces
description: The Republicans may have had a big night, but new media and technology had a great run through the electorate as well. The voting machines seemed to work, give or take a few problems, producing a result that was as clear as the headlines on Wednesday morning. That process was covered, endlessly, by old and newmedia outlets which used all kinds of technical might to deliver the evenings huge data output.

title: Strong October Sales for Automakers
description: DETROIT  October was the best month for new-vehicle sales in more than two years, outside of the brief period in 2009 helped by government rebates. In addition, General Motors surpassed expectations but still lost market share in the United States ahead of its public stock offering.

title: Elizabeth Cady Stanton Dies at Her Home
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Cady Stanton died at 3 o'clock yesterday afternoon at her home in the Stuart Apartment House, 250 West Ninety-fourth Street. Had she lived until the 12th of next month she would have completed her eighty-seventh year. Mrs. Stanton had been ailing for several months, but had not been seriously ill. Of recent years she became very stout, and this, combined with her naturally large frame, made the use of a cane necessary. Saturday she was confined to her bed. Though physically incapacitated, her mental powers were as much in evidence as ever, and only in the first part of the week she had written two articles for publication. Early on Saturday Mrs. Stanton dictated to her secretary a letter.

title: Our Men In Drives On Guadalcanal
description: Washington, Nov. 11 -- The Army and Marine forces on Guadalcanal Island carried out offensive action against the Japanese there both on the east and west on Monday (Solomons date), the Navy reported in a communique issued here today. The communique indicated, by lack of word to the contrary, that the operations proceeded successfully. Army planes based in Alaska destroyed seven Japanese seaplanes and damaged two cargo vessels in the western reaches of the Aleutian Islands, the Navy said.

title: Your College Major May Not Be As Important As You Think
description: Heres an excerpt from a letter that an indignant father sent to his son after hearing that he had opted for an impractical major:

title: Kurosawas Feudal Japan, Now Onstage
description: TURNING Throne of Blood, Akira Kurosawas acclaimed film adaptation of Macbeth, into a play might seem, on the surface, an odd idea. Not only is the movie light on dialogue, incorporating none of Shakespeares text, but also many of its most striking images  the bleak landscape shrouded in fog, the massive castle, the hundreds of soldiers on horseback  are virtually impossible to reproduce onstage.

title: High Court Rules Bus Segregation Unconstitutional
description: Washington, Nov. 13  An Alabama law and a city ordinance requiring segregation of races on intrastate buses were declared invalid by the Supreme Court today.

title: Death of R. L. Stevenson
description: LONDON, Dec. 17.--A dispatch to The Star, dated Apia, Samoa, Dec. 8, confirms the report that Robert Louis Stevenson, the novelist, died suddenly a few days ago from apoplexy. His body was buried on the summit of Paa Mountain, 1,300 feet high.

title: On Taxes, Voting for Status Quo
description: 8:50 p.m. | Updated with California result

title: The New Kids in Town
description: Gail Collins: David, the Republicans now have control of the House of Representatives. I admit it was difficult listening to the incoming speaker of the House, John Boehner, get weepy and tell us once again how he used to mop up at his fathers tavern. But the people have spoken, and Im kinda looking forward to having some Republican authority figures to complain about for a change.

title: The Tea Party Giveth
description: If you look at the 2010 midterms in the aggregate, the Tea Party phenomenon looks like an enormous plus for the Republican Party. The right-wing demoralization of 2008 evaporated, and conservative turnout surged. Exit polls showed 4 in 10 voters expressed support for the Tea Parties. In House races, state house races, and state legislature races, the movement seems to have been immensely successful at energizing the grassroots without turning off moderates and independents.

title: Americas Political Map, Scrambled
description: To the Editor:

title: A Womens Running Pioneer Enjoys Life in the Slow Lane
description: When Miki Gorman ran her first marathon in 1973, she was 38 years old. She had taken up running five years earlier believing that it would stoke her appetite and help her gain weight.

title: In Bush Memoir, Policy Intersects With Personality
description: George W. Bushs memoir Decision Points could well have been titled The Decider Decides: its an autobiography focused around the most consequential decisions of his presidency and his personal life from his decision to give up drinking in 1986 to his decision to invade Iraq in 2003 to his decisions regarding the financial crisis of 2008. It is a book that is part spin, part mea culpa, part family scrapbook, part self-conscious effort to (re)shape his political legacy.

title: Some Financiers Fare Poorly in Electoral Races
description: 12:33 p.m. | Updated While Wall Street may have cheered the regaining of the House of Representatives by Republicans in Tuesdays midterm elections, some individual financiers fared less well in their races.

title: Testy Pistons Coming Apart Quickly
description: 4:47 p.m. | Updated Bostons Kevin Garnett responded to allegations by Detroits Charlie Villanueva that he he had called Villanueva a cancer patient during Tuesday nights game. He released a statement:

title: Randy Moss for Hire
description: Now that weve disposed of that pesky World Series, gotten through those nettlesome N.F.L. and college football games for the week and with the Knicks even canceling a game to free up some cosmic space, we can move on to the real main event: the Randy Moss sweepstakes. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, this is your opportunity to acquire the N.F.L.s loosest cannon, a receiver who runs an occasional route at full speed, may or may not be paying attention to your season, and, for good measure, may erupt in anger at the people putting out the players pregame buffet.

title: Republican Leaders Say They Have a Mandate From the American People
description: Newly empowered Republican Congressional leaders challenged President Obama and the Democratic Party today to turn in their direction after an election that they described as a clear message from the American people.

title: Cutting Up, Rocking Out and Jamming on Ukuleles
description: The most revelatory moment in the Ukulele Orchestra of Great Britains concert at Zankel Hall on Tuesday evening probably came during its performance of Psycho Killer, the Talking Heads song, when you realized that David Byrne had missed the boat by not recording the tune with an ensemble of singing ukulele players. Or maybe it was during the groups gracefully sung, delicately plucked account of David Bowies Life on Mars, an idiosyncratic reading of an offbeat selection, even before it morphed into a handful of songs from entirely different universes: among them Stevie Wonders For Once in My Life, the theme song from Born Free and the Whos Substitute.

title: From Cirque du Soleil, a Michael Jackson-Themed Touring Show
description: 1:05 p.m. | Updated

title: Simply Put, We Must, Um, Well
description: I probably shouldnt be too hard on Mohamed el-Erian; hes a very smart guy, and makes much more sense than most people out there. But reading his latest op-ed, I had the sense that I was seeing an important clue to the mess were in.

title: An Election Breakdown, the Day After
description: Andrew M. Cuomos victory was one of the more lopsided wins that any candidate for New York governor has recorded.

title: From Scion to Service Provider
description: MARC KUSHNER picked a tough time to become an architect. After graduating from Harvards design school in 2004, he was still clawing his way up when the air hissed out of the inflated, big-ticket commissions. That luxury condo tower in Las Vegas? Kaboom, Mr. Kushner said. The condo in Miami? Kaboom.

title: Whoopi Goldberg Has Just the Show for Families: Hers
description: Whoopi Goldberg may go for serious subject matter in her film work, like The Color Purple and the coming For Colored Girls, and racy jokes in her comedy, like her attack on George W. Bushs last name in 2004, but she has a fixation about family-friendly entertainment on Broadway.

title: Richardson Gains Ground in Iowa
description: Bill Richardson has been slowly and steadily rising in the polls as he aims his Iowa campaign squarely at John Edwards.

title: In Praise of the Bookmakers
description: Bill Barichs books include the racetrack classic Laughing in the Hills, A Fine Place to Daydream, and the newly published Long Way Home: On the Trail of Steinbecks America.

title: Graphic Content | Another Great IDEA
description: Over the past couple of years, some important graphic design magazines in the United States and abroad have folded or severely reduced their pages, and even the survivors are increasingly migrating to digital formats. Although a few standbys are still plugging away in printed form, there is one magazine that has so successfully resisted digital pressures that it has even expanded its scope. IDEA: International Graphic Art and Typography, now in its 343rd issue, is one of the most beautifully designed and comprehensively edited graphic design magazines in the world. It is a model of acuity and panache. And yet I cannot always decipher it because it is in Japanese.

title: WWD Celebrates 100 Years
description: Photos from the fashion newspapers 100th anniversary bash.

title: Womens Wear Daily Is How Old?
description: SO what Im hearing is that the fashion industry is not doing very well, said Vera Wang, a very famous designer who was wearing a body-hugging gray sweater dress under a belt trimmed with a veil of leather fringe that looked kind of like a kilt, as she took a sip of a screwdriver.

title: Mistakes First-Time Home Buyers Make
description: My husband and I are in the market to buy our first home. After looking for months, we were convinced last week that we had finally found a property that fit our requirements. We made an offer and, after a bit of negotiating, it was accepted.

title: Cantor Offers Himself as Majority Leader
description: Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia formally announced Wednesday his intention to run for the second-highest leadership job in the House.

title: Entrepreneur Has Uncle Mo Going for Him
description: When he was growing up in Middle Village, Queens, a poor child from a working-class neighborhood, Mike Repole was pretty sure he could do anything. Maybe he would play shortstop for the Mets someday or become a multimillionaire. Maybe hed own a young racehorse that would run so fast that anything, even a Kentucky Derby win, would seem possible. Repole never did play for the Mets. Other than that, hes doing pretty well.

title: Honda CR-Z Finds Tuner Love at SEMA Show
description: LAS VEGAS  Honda once owned the aftermarket tuner market, but about a decade ago, the Japanese automaker started bringing out more mild-mannered models that intentionally turned away from the high-performance crowd. Now, it appears Honda wants at least part of that market back, and a collection of radically tweaked CR-Z hybrids on display at this years SEMA Show is meant to do just that.

title: Overnight, Maine Turns Red
description: WATERVILLE, Me.  Paul LePage, the Republican mayor here, has won the governors race, narrowly fending off an independent candidate riding a late burst of support.

title: Popcast: Latin Music Special
description: This weeks Popcast, The Timess music podcast, takes a look at Latin music with Times critics and reporters on the short history of the Latin Grammys and the long and tangled history of the Cuban-American jazz exchange.

title: Another Move for Eric Hara
description: Youll need a GPS to follow Eric Hara these days. He left David Burkes empire to become the executive chef at the Oak Room in the Plaza. Hes reduced his workload there, becoming consulting chef with his cooks in place. He is now the executive chef and a partner, with Sal Romano, at Agua Dulce on Ninth Avenue and 53rd Street (whose original chef, Ulrich A. Sterling, left this summer) and 9, next door to Agua Dulce. The original chef of 9, which opened for about 15 minutes and is now temporarily closed, was Michael Berardino, who is out. The food at 9 will now go from Mediterranean to American. Mr. Hara has also resigned as the consulting chef for two restaurants, Siena and Dekko in Astoria, Queens, which have yet to open.

title: Great Unknowns: Shipwrecks and Subway Riders Edition
description: It is a mystery left unsolved every day: who are these people in my subway car?

title: Long After Spill, BP Gets F Ratings for Alaska Pipelines
description: Is there another BP disaster waiting to happen, this time in Alaska?

title: What Clicks on a Big Day: The Front Page
description: Sure, the steady bleed of readers from print to the Web is only getting worse. But there is still no substitute forA1 the day after a big news story.

title: TimesCast | November 3, 2010
description: The day after the elections, we look at Nevada; the governor's races; Capitol Hill and the Tea Party.

title: Obama Takes Responsibility for Voter Frustration
description: 1:55 p.m. | Updated A subdued President Obama acknowledged the drubbing his party took at the polls on Tuesday night, promising to work harder to build consensus and admitting that it had been a long night for him.

title: Brooklyn Beauties | The Crme of Cobble Hill
description: It was at a Jay-Z concert that Jessica Richards met Julia Stringer, her partner in the Brooklyn shop Shen Beauty. I thought she was a prim-and-proper English girl, says the American-born Richards of the beauty journalist, whose Green Queen column has appeared in The Daily Mail. We are such polar opposites, its not even funny. Still, the two decided to have lunch (at Spring Street Natural, naturally), and soon hatched the plan for Shen Beauty, the Cobble Hill emporium named for an Egyptian hieroglyph symbolizing protection of the earth.

title: The Missed Rally
description: The stock market hit bottom in March 2009, and when it started to move up, some mutual fund investors jumped in. There were net inflows into domestic stock funds in each month from April through July.

title: The Missed Rally
description: The stock market hit bottom in March 2009, and when it started to move up, some mutual fund investors jumped in. There were net inflows into domestic stock funds in each month from April through July.

title: Will Additional Fed Action Help the Economy?
description: 2:26 p.m. | Updated  The Federal Reserve announced today that it would buy an additional $600 billion in long-term Treasury securities by the end of June 2011.

title: What Were Reading
description: KFSK Radio: Sitka tribe urges enforcement of laws preventing outsiders from harvesting herring roe.  Sam Sifton

title: A Bunker Mentality, Busted
description: BAGHDAD  The muffled thuds of a bombing rolled through my open bedroom windows around dinnertime. For a moment, they sounded like thunderclaps  there had been an autumn storm just a day earlier  but these sounds, this sickening succession of concussion waves rippling across Baghdad, suggested something different.

title: Teaching Children How to Vote
description: When I was 3 or 4, my father took me into the voting booth for the first time. He had to lift me high to help him push the levers, and on the way home we talked, Im sure, about Democracy and Responsibility and How Machines Count So Very High. Over the years he lifted me less often, and the talks driving home became more nuanced, but it was a ritual, that visit to the voting booth  closing the curtain, making a hushed and private choice, snapping the curtain open again.

title: The Strange Death of Fiscal Policy
description: One clear result of the midterms is that we wont have anything like a further round of stimulus. And this, in turn, means that the narrative all the Very Serious People will tell is that fiscal policy was tried, it failed, and thats that.

title: Reid Assails Polls That Predicted His Loss
description: NEVADA  Senator Harry Reid of Nevada has long made a point of saying he doesnt like polls. Throughout these last two years  as Mr. Reid saw poll after poll suggesting he was in trouble  he told whoever would listen that the polls were wrong, that he was going to win, and that he was not concerned. Outside his circle, it seems fair to say that not many people believed him.

title: BofA to Sell Most of Its BlackRock Stake
description: Underscoring its goal of slimming down and shedding noncore assets, Bank of America disclosed Wednesday that it would sell the majority of its stake in BlackRock, the worlds biggest publicly traded money management firm.

title: Not Quiet on the Western Front
description: SEATTLE  As usual, most voters were asleep when the West defied the conventional wisdom and the pollsters with results and lessons galore:

title: Ai Weiwei Plans a Celebration, of Sorts, to Mark Demolition of His Studio
description: The Chinese conceptual artist Ai Weiwei seemed to take in stride an announcement by Chinas government that it would tear down his new studio in Shanghai after saying he doesnt have a proper permit for it. Mr. Ai, writing on his Twitter account, said that he would celebrate the occasion by holding a banquet for his supporters, Agence France-Presse reported.

title: A New Name on the Morphoses Roster
description: Morphoses, the dance company co-founded by the choreographer Christopher Wheeldon, has figured out its plans after Mr. Wheeldon abruptly announced his departure as artistic director in February. His co-founder and the companys director, Lourdes Lopez, said on Wednesday that a different artistic director will be put in place each season. First on the list is Luca Veggetti, the Italian stage director and choreographer. He will produce an original, full-length, multidisciplinary staging of Euripides Bacchae next season, collaborating with the Italian composer Paolo Aralla, the performance artist and playwright Luca Scarlini and the flutist Erin Lesser, the company said.

title: Nobody Cares About Process
description: Urk. I just gave up on the presidential press conference. When Obama declared that Americans rejected Democrats in part because We were in such a hurry to get things done that we didnt change how things got done, I checked out.

title: The Rush of Amazon Geology, and Stingrays
description: Thursday, Oct. 28

title: A Surge in Lawsuits Challenging E.P.A. on Climate
description: With many eyes on how Tuesdays elections will affect Congressional action on climate and energy issues, a new report points out that the battle over greenhouse gas emissions has been raging quietly on another front: the courts.

title: Quote Unquote | DIY, Baby
description: Kate Moss tells Hilary Alexander about her new bangs. Stylists around the world freak out.

title: An Analysts View of Election Fallout
description: The good news, at least according to Les Funtleyder, a portfolio manager and health care strategist at Miller Tabak & Company, is that Tuesdays election results do not mean the new health care law will be overturned.

title: Fed Will Buy $600 Billion in Debt, Hoping to Spur Growth
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, concerned about the slow recovery, announced a second, large purchase of Treasury bonds on Wednesday, an effort to spur economic growth by lowering long-term interest rates.

title: Food Festival Cuisine for Thanksgiving
description: Every February for the past decade, Food Network stars and chefs from some of the countrys most celebrated restaurants gather in Florida for the South Beach Wine and Food Festival. Emeril Lagasse has called the event spring break for chefs.

title: Andre Braugher to Star in Whipping Man for Manhattan Theater Club
description: Andre Braugher, the versatile actor best known for his Emmy-winning role as Det. Frank Pembleton in Homicide: Life on the Street, has been cast in The Whipping Man, a drama by Matthew Lopez about a Jewish Confederate soldier and his two former slaves right after the Civil War.

title: With Recovery Slow, Fed to Buy $600 Billion in Debt
description: The Federal Reserve, concerned about the slow recovery, announced a second, large purchase of Treasury bonds on Wednesday, an effort to spur economic growth by lowering long-term interest rates, The New York Times reports.

title: Blackberry Jam
description: Collision between smartphone-distracted pedestrians.

title: Timeline: The Activist Fed
description: Key moments in the financial and economic downturn of the last three years, and the Feds response.

title: Lavo
description: GO-GO dancers in bikinis, sparklers bursting from Champagne bottles, persistent techno music. These are touchstones a New Yorker may expect from an outpost of a Las Vegas hot spot  and Lavo wont prove them wrong. Owned by the team behind Marquee, Avenue and Tao, this Mediterranean-inflected nightclub is yet another destination for the older, well-heeled patrons who took over much of the meatpacking district.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Afghanistan, Indonesia and Belarus.

title: Hearing With the Heart
description: MY midlife obsession with Stephen Sondheim began on a Friday night in April 14 years ago, when my daughter Kate persuaded me to take her to her schools spring musical. She was 12, a seventh grader dreaming of the day when she would be cast in one of the schools productions. I was 44, a lifelong jazz snob, who viewed the prospect of watching teenagers perform a musical with dread. We were going to see something called Sweeney Todd. Id never heard of it. Music and lyrics by Mr. Sondheim. I had no clue.

description: As a Republican wave swept across the United States on Tuesday, the Fox News Channel drew the biggest midterm election audience in its history.

But perhaps the most important thing at stake was Rachel Jenningss perfect record against her sisters.

title: Poti Overcomes Scary Injury to Return for Capitals

title: Saving Social Security
description: The budget deficit figured prominently in much of the discussion surrounding yesterdays election. Yet the outcome of the election will do little of meaning to restrain our medium-term deficits  and arguably makes a serious medium-term deficit reduction package less likely. The silver lining is that the election could make Social Security reform more likely  if the administration chooses to jump at the opportunity.

title: Seattle Symphony Names New Executive Director
description: The Seattle Symphony, suffering from a momentary leadership vacuum, has settled on a British orchestra official, Simon Woods, as its next executive director. Mr. Woods, a former president and chief executive of the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra who is now chief executive of the Royal Scottish National Orchestra, will take over in Seattle in May, the orchestra said on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Mr. Woods will spend one week a month in Seattle starting in January, a spokeswoman said, and the chairwoman of the orchestras board, Leslie Jackson Chihuly, is taking an active role until he arrives. The orchestras previous top administrator left in February, and a temporary replacement departed last month. Mr. Woodss arrival will coincide with that of the new music director, Ludovic Morlot, who takes over next season from Gerard Schwarz. Mr. Schwarz is in his 26th season with the orchestra.

title: Scott Brown Effect? Not in Massachusetts
description: When Scott R. Brown stunned the nation by winning Edward M. Kennedys longtime Senate seat last winter, putting it in Republican hands for the first time in decades, he inspired legions of upstart Republicans to challenge seemingly invincible Democrats.

title: Introducing the New and Old Luis Scola
description: The beginning of the season has not been kind to the Houston Rockets. Not only have the first three games brought just as many losses, but along with those losses come painful reminders of the limitations of both Yao Ming and the team as a whole. Houston has been the worst defensive outfit in the league, allowing a miserable 116.2 points per 100 possessions. The cap on Yaos minutes has made the centers return bittersweet, and the Rockets efforts, commendable but futile, equally so.

She began riding horses at 9 and owned several thoroughbreds over the years that she rode for pleasure. Shes confident they taught her far more than she ever could teach them.

title: Play It Again, Paul: Another Lecture-Demonstration of a Bach Monument
description: For those of us with short attention spans, the organist Paul Jacobs is doing a good service. He has added a second lecture-demonstration in advance of his Nov. 16 performance of the third book of Bachs Clavierbung, a complex and monumental work, to celebrate the reinstallation of the Kuhn organ at Alice Tully Hall. Mr. Jacobs discussed the work and played excerpts on Oct. 27 at Christ and St. Stephens Episcopal Church on West 69th Street, where he is artist in residence. He has added a similar session at the church on Tuesday, at 7:30 p.m. ($10 suggested donation). The concert is part of Lincoln Centers White Light Festival.

description: At the global climate change conference in Copenhagen in December, President Obama pledged to cut United States emissions from 2005 levels by 17 percent by 2020  if he could get Congress to pass climate and energy legislation.

description: It was only a few years ago that Henry Paulson, as Treasury secretary, produced shock and awe by proposing that $800 billion go into what became the Troubled Asset Relief Program to bail out the banks. It was a sum so huge that it was hard to comprehend.

title: YouTube Removes Sermons by Radical Cleric
description: Updated | 6:59 p.m. Responding to complaints from American and British officials, YouTube on Wednesday removed from its site some of the hundreds of videos featuring calls to jihad by Anwar al-Awlaki, an American-born cleric based in Yemen who has been blamed for radicalizing Muslims involved in a string of terrorist attacks.

title: Hillary Clinton Responds to Democratic Losses  From Papua New Guinea

title: Jerry Bock, Fiddler on the Roof Composer, Dies at 81
description: Jerry Bock, who wrote his first musical in public school and went on to compose the scores for some of Broadways most successful shows, including Fiddler on the Roof, Fiorello! and She Loves Me, died on Wednesday in Mount Kisco, N.Y. He was 81 and lived in Manhattan.

title: Face Time | Bottega Venetas BVX
description: Bottega Veneta, best known for its high level of artisanal craftsmanship and logo-free take on luxury living, has partnered with the Swiss watch giant Girard Perregaux to produce its first watch, the BVX. As elegantly subtle as the houses signature woven leather accessories, the unisex watch features a dark, brushed-titanium curved case with a brown face and a cigar-colored crocodile strap. But dont let the sexy simplicity fool you: inside this chic exterior lies an 18-karat rose gold automatic movement made expressly by Girard Perregaux for Bottega Veneta. And this watch has a face that even Dorian Gray could love, with nary a name or initial marring its smooth, lacquered surface, adhering strictly to the companys famous motto: When your own initials are enough. The BVX is $14,600 and will be available starting in December.

title: Turkey Links Suicide Bomber in Istanbul to Kurdish Separatists
description: ISTANBUL  The suicide bomber who attacked a police unit in the heart of Istanbul on Sunday had ties to the separatist Kurdistan Workers Party, the Istanbul governors office said Tuesday.

title: Political Football
description: Republicans proved on Tuesday that they know how to block and tackle  and, in the case of some of them, quite literally. Jon Runyan, the Republican from New Jersey who won a seat in the House on Tuesday, is a former N.F.L. lineman who played 14 seasons for the Houston Oilers, the Philadelphia Eagles and others.

title: To Soak or Not?
description: In my column this week I divulge the fact that I no longer soak dried beans before cooking them. If youre like me, and dont know that you want to make bean stew until, well, the moment you want to make bean stew, then that eight-hour prep just isnt in the cards.That said, soaking beans overnight to soften them is really a great choice if youre the kind of person who knows what you will want for dinner tomorrow. The eight hours or so spent in the water drastically reduces the cooking time. This saves energy and gets your dinner on the table faster once you bring everything to a boil. So feel free to soak the beans for this recipe if youre so inclined. Just watch them carefully to see when they are done  probably in half the time it took me with unsoaked beans.Another issue that I briefly bring up in the column is refrigerating the beans while they soak. Years ago, I was taught that soaking beans might start to ferment if left in a very warm room overnight. Soaking in the fridge eliminates this concern. However, several readers have written to me saying that they never refrigerate their soaking beans and havent had any problems. One friend, from the Caribbean, said she always soaks her beans outside on the porch overnight in 80-degree weather, and that those beans seem to cook up perfectly well.Im curious to hear how you do it  do you soak at room temperature or in the fridge? What about quick soaking? Many readers use pressure cookers, so Im asking, do you soak if you use a pressure cooker? Leave a comment to share your leguminous adventures.

description: Garry Kasparov, the former world champion, retired from chess in 2005, but he has not rested on his laurels. He has become involved in Russian politics as a leader of a the government opposition, hit the speaker circuit, and become a prolific author, mostly on chess, though he wrote a business strategy book, How Life Imitates Chess: Making the Right Moves, From the Board to the Boardroom (Bloomsbury USA, 2007).

Now these people are everywhere in America, and theyre cooking anything they can get their hands on, around the clock  tutti foodie.

The Titans were 23rd in the waiver order  which goes from the team having the worst record to the best  which means no team higher in the order put in a claim for the talented but mercurial receiver, who was waived just four weeks after the Minnesota Vikings gave up a third-round draft pick to acquire him.

So it was a no-brainer for Lincoln Center to invite Mr. Herreweghe to participate in the White Light Festival, a three-week exploration of music that delves into spiritual realms.

title: Dancing and Voting
description: The television networks interrupted much of their prime-time schedules on Tuesday for election results, but ABC dominated the early part of the night with its Dancing With the Stars results episode. It attracted 16.8 million viewers from 8 to 9:30 p.m., according to Nielsens estimates. That number was subject to revision in final ratings results, but ABC appeared to lead the night over all, averaging 7.4 million viewers from 9:30 to 11 for its election coverage. CBS placed second with reruns of NCIS (11.5 million) and NCIS: Los Angeles (11.1 million) from 8 to 10 followed by news coverage (5.2 million). NBC was third, and Fox was fourth.

title: Victory! Defeat! Oh, the Humility
description: There is something about elections that apparently makes the people who participate in them feel small, which is interesting considering the outsized ego often required to run for public office in America these days. The election-emotion is a sense of humility that apparently is not bound by victory or defeat.

title: Taylor Swift Album Is a Sales Triumph

But this week the recording industry got a rare bit of good news with the unmitigated triumph of Taylor Swifts Speak Now.

Yet the most attractive part of the Cedar Lake package is its 15 dancers  even in less-than-stellar pieces and wearing socks. (They love to dance in socks.)

So he was nonplussed last year when he discovered that someone had been tossing plastic bags of dog excrement into the sculptured shrubs around a palm tree in his front yard.

title: In NoHo, a Bento Box They Can Live In
description: MOST architects meet their clients through referrals or networking. Mishi Hosono and Adam Weintraub, of Koko Architecture and Design in Manhattan, met one of theirs just before their wedding 12 years ago, when Ms. Hosono was trying to figure out how to put on the dress she planned to wear.

title: On Marathon Sunday, the Long Haul Begins Before Dawn

Teichman, 31, signed up for the races official transportation and was assigned to a bus leaving the New York Public Library on Fifth Avenue.

title: Whos Getting Endplayed?
description: The bronze medal winners in the Imp Pairs at the world championships in Philadelphia last month were Kelley Hwang of New York and John Zilic of Houston. They defended carefully in the diagramed deal, Board 9 of the final session.

title: Gates Foundation Gives $30 Million to Smithsonian
description: The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has given the Smithsonian Institution $30 million to create an endowment for online education programs aimed at students in underserved communities. The donation was reported on Wednesday by the Puget Sound Business Journal. In a press release, the Smithsonian said it would use the donation to build on existing programs that use interactive Web sites, online conferences, distance learning and games to reach new audiences. The donation follows two $10 million grants by the foundation to the Smithsonian since 2009, one of them to support the construction of the new National Museum of African American History and Culture. The chairwoman of the Smithsonians board of regents, Patricia Q. Stonesifer, is a former chief executive of the Gates Foundation.

title: Tech Talk Podcast: Online Privacy
description: Although the Federal Trade Commission last week dropped its investigation of personal data inadvertently collected by Googles StreetView cars, state authorities and officials in European and other countries are still looking into privacy issues related to the service. On this weeks Tech Talk podcast, Bettina Edelstein talks to Claire Cain Miller, a New York Times technology reporter who covers Google, about the latest developments. Ms. Miller says that Google has taken new steps aimed at protecting privacy, which satisfied the F.T.C., but consumer groups and privacy advocates are dismayed about the agencys decision. Google recently revealed that in addition to location photos, its StreetView cars gathered passwords and e-mail from unencrypted Wi-Fi networks.

title: Garden Officials Reopen Arena After an Asbestos Scare
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  A fire alarm blared at the Knicks training center Wednesday, its shrill bursts disturbing an otherwise peaceful afternoon. No one was evacuated. No fire trucks rushed to the scene. Another false alarm.
