title: Pelosi Coy on Future in Post-Election Interview
description: Nancy Pelosis time as Speaker of the House is almost up, but she is not yet tipping her hand.

title: A Few Chores Before the Freeze
description: IN the spirit of full disclosure, I have to admit the garden has not looked so good lately. I lost control of it at the end of the summer when I took a vacation to Cape Cod. It seemed like an extravagance to hire someone to water and weed, and anyway, I figured, the flowers could withstand a few weeks on their own.

title: Wall Street Gets Its Groove Back
description: By SUSANNE CRAIG

title: Amid a Tea Party Whirlwind, Connecticut Is an Island of Calm
description: HARTFORD

title: Sales at George Smith, Sferra and Others
description: Silver flatware, hollowware, crystal, porcelain and frames are 40 to 70 percent off during the Christofle sale at Soiffer Haskin, through Nov. 7 (the Atomes dArgent Candelabra by Richard Hutton, regularly $1,300, is $780; a Menorah by Adam Tihany, originally $2,000, is $1,200); 317 West 33rd Street (Eighth Avenue), (718) 747-1656, soifferhaskin.com.

title: Floor Covering Transformed
description: Randy Twaddle began drawing electrical transformers  those metal boxes on telephone poles  more than a decade ago.

title: France: Extradition Order For Rwandan
description: A French court on Wednesday ordered the extradition of a Rwandan rebel leader to the International Criminal Court in The Hague on charges of raping and killing civilians in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The rebel, Callixte Mbarushimana, was arrested in Paris in October on a warrant from the international court, which has charged him with 11 counts of war crimes and crimes against humanity. Prosecutors say he is the main political leader of the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda, which uses Congo as a base to attack the Tutsi-led government of Rwanda across the border. Mr. Mbarushimana, 47, plans to appeal the extradition ruling, his lawyer told The Associated Press.

title: Bunny Williams Scrapbook for Living
description: If you want a book to beat yourself over the head with while bewailing your shortcomings as a host, housekeeper and decorator, we recommend Bunny Williams Scrapbook for Living (Stewart Tabori & Chang; $60). First of all, it is heavy. Second, it is chock full of beautiful instructive pictures on things like how to set up a bar for a party, which will torment you even more, because, frankly, yours will never look this good.

title: Facebook Offers Local Deals for Mobile Users
description: Facebook introduced a feature on Wednesday that will allow retailers and other merchants to offer coupons and special deals through its mobile application, intensifying competition in the market for mobile searches and advertising.

title: Cooper-Hewitt Opens Kiosk in Grand Central
description: For downtown design aficionados and others who have lamented the geographic undesirability of the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum on East 91st Street, a satellite version of the museums shop is now open in Grand Central Terminal. The small, tightly edited store  a kiosk in the Graybar Passage  will carry 25 products, including Cynthia Rowleys Band-Aids ($10); patterned masking tape ($22), right bottom; the PlayShapes Wooden Toy by Miller Goodman ($150), right top; and at the high end, the Junghans table clock ($360). Gregory Krum, the museums director of retail, who is overseeing the kiosk, said he envisioned it as a gem-like thing in a dark and gritty passage with a very strong, carefully considered selection of stuff. Open Monday through Saturday, through the end of January; information: (212) 661-0298 or cooperhewittshop.org.

title: The Risks in Alcoholic Drinks
description: To the Editor:

title: YouTube Withdraws Clerics Videos
description: LONDON  Under pressure from American and British officials, YouTube on Wednesday removed from its site some of the hundreds of videos featuring calls to jihad by Anwar al-Awlaki, an American-born, Yemen-based cleric who has played an increasingly public role in inspiring violence directed at the West.

title: End Tables
description: JON CALL believes that end tables are the stepchildren of the living room, overlooked and ignored in favor of the sofa, the star of the room. And hed like to change that.

title: How the Feds Move Could Trickle Down to Consumers
description: WASHINGTON  In its latest move to help the economy, the Federal Reserve is about to restart its monetary printing press  or rather, the electronic equivalent.

title: A Slave Ship in New York
description: New York, Nov. 4, 1860

title: G.M. Cleared to Use Private Jets to Promote Stock Sale
description: 5:41 p.m. | Updated General Motors executives have been cleared for takeoff again.

title: Buffalo Takes Paladinos Defeat in Stride
description: BUFFALO  For what turned out to be a fleeting moment, he shone a spotlight on this struggling city tucked away in a corner of New York State. And the day after the man with the spotlight, Carl P. Paladino, was trounced in the election for governor, his hometown offered a collective shrug.

title: G.O.P. Expands a Base From South to Midwest
description: LAS VEGAS  For Democrats, the new political map colored by the midterm elections was nothing short of bracing: Vast stretches of uninterrupted Republican victories across the Midwest and the South, with Democrats left clinging to the coasts, lonely strips of blue on a very red horizon.

title: G.O.P. Faces Choice in How to Oppose
description: The day after the election always dawns sunny and full of hope in Washington. From Representative John A. Boehner on down, Republicans talked on Wednesday about how open they were to working with the president (except, perhaps, for repealing that whole health care thing). Rand Paul, the next senator from Kentucky, said on MSNBC that his family was hoping to meet the Obama girls. You could almost see the two dads stretched out in front of the TV, sharing a laugh at Phineas and Ferb.

title: Ouster of Iowa Judges Sends Signal to Bench
description: DES MOINES  An unprecedented vote to remove three Iowa Supreme Court justices who were part of the unanimous decision that legalized same-sex marriage in the state was celebrated by conservatives as a popular rebuke of judicial overreach, even as it alarmed proponents of an independent judiciary.

title: Israel: Officials Cancel Trip To Britain
description: A Foreign Ministry official confirmed Wednesday that Israeli officials would not travel to London this month for an annual British-Israeli strategic dialogue because of the fear of arrest. Britain adheres to the principle of universal jurisdiction, which allows its judges to issue arrest warrants against anyone suspected of war crimes anywhere in the world. Pro-Palestinian activists have threatened Israeli officials with arrest on allegations of war crimes against Palestinians, causing several officials to cancel plans to visit Britain. In Jerusalem on Wednesday, the British foreign secretary, William Hague, reiterated his governments commitment to resolving what he called the unacceptable situation with regard to universal jurisdiction. An Israeli Foreign Ministry spokesman, Yigal Palmor, said that the issue was the top item on Israels agenda for Mr. Hagues visit.

title: Shift May Push Democrats to Compromise on Tax Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday invited Congressional Republican leaders to negotiate about extending the soon-to-expire Bush-era tax cuts, but he stood his ground by arguing against the Republicans demand to keep those cuts for income above $250,000.

title: Invitation to Veterans, Friends and Families
description: The editors of Home Fires are requesting the participation of readers for a post on Veterans Day, Nov. 11. If you are a veteran, or friend or relative of someone who served during wartime and would like to share a written message or recollection, or a photograph recalling a veteran or their service, you can send it to us via e-mail at opinionator@nytimes.com. Please put HOME FIRES in the subject line of your message.

title: Shopping With Jon Call
description: Jon Call, an interior designer and the owner of Mr. Call Designs, believes that end tables are the stepchildren of the living room, overlooked and ignored in favor of larger pieces. And hed like to change that.

title: Tending to Sick Computers, and Their Owners
description: Aurora Thornhill used to work at an apple orchard near Limerick, Me., where she grew up. Now she spends her days with Apples. Ms. Thornhill, 26, is an assistant retail manager at Tekserve, the independently owned Apple store on West 23rd Street in Manhattan. She started there in March 2008, working in the intake section  Tekserves triage unit, where an ailing computer is given a diagnosis. She has since become an expert in gadget protection, developing her own technique, using compressed air and a credit card, for applying screen protectors to iPads  the kind of thing the techies at Tekserve obsess about.

title: Fed Gets Aggressive After Months of Holding Back
description: For much of the last year, there were three basic camps on what the Federal Reserve should be doing.

title: Out With the Lamb Chops and in With the Lasagna
description: A change in the occupant of the governors mansion in Albany can mean more than a new direction in public policy. The states chief executive can also set the tone with his style. Herewith, a taste of the old and the new:

title: Colombia Suspends 7 in Military After Childrens Killings
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Colombias army has suspended seven officers and soldiers for failing to control their troops in connection with the brutal murders last month of three impoverished children near Colombias northeast border with Venezuela.

title: Promise of Renewed Battle Over Reach of Health Care
description: While Republicans cannot fulfill their campaign promise to repeal the new health care law any time soon, they can lead Congress in a sweeping re-examination of its more unpopular provisions, including new taxes and a requirement for most Americans to carry health insurance.

title: Finish Rabins Work
description: TODAY marks 15 years since an assassins bullet killed my friend, Yitzhak Rabin, the Israeli prime minister. Since his death, not a week has gone by that I have not missed him. I loved him and his wife, Leah, very much. On the occasion of the anniversary of his death, his yahrzeit, the world would do well to remember the lessons of his life: his vision for freedom, tolerance, cooperation, security and peace is as vital now as it was 15 years ago, when he happily spoke and sang for peace at a huge rally in Tel Aviv just before he was killed.

title: Fannie and Freddie Face Uncertain Future
description: House Republicans have made punching bags of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, criticizing the federal bailout of the mortgage giants and promising to end the governments longstanding use of the companies to reduce the cost of mortgage loans.

title: Sitting Here Thinking of Acapulco
description: Jamey Garza has been intrigued by the Acapulco chair  which has a colorful nylon-cord or plastic bucket seat on top of an iron base  since he first encountered it nearly 10 years ago. Mr. Garza, an artist and designer, and his wife, Constance Holt-Garza, had two of the cord version in their yard in Marfa, Tex., and while the chairs didnt age well, they did provide inspiration for a new design. We realized we could redefine the Acapulco chair by making it an interior piece, with a wishbone leg base and a leather bucket seat, he said. The Garzas have spent the better part of this year refining their chair, and last month they introduced three versions  round, oval and square  all hand-made of quarter-inch-thick saddle leather set atop iron bases, which come in plain black or a choice of seven powder-coated colors. Prices start at $500 (the Desert Round Lounge Chair is $650); information: (432) 729-1946 or garzadesignbuild.com.

title: Money for Scientific Research May Be Scarce With a Republican-Led House
description: Federal financing of science research, which has risen quickly since the Obama administration came to power, could fall back to pre-Obama levels if the incoming Republican leadership in the House of Representatives follows through on its list of campaign promises.

title: Seeking a New Laws Protection, Loft Tenants Instead Find Grief
description: After New York State passed a law this summer extending residential rights to people living in illegal lofts in much of the city, the seven tenants of 360 Jefferson Street in Bushwick, Brooklyn, acted fast.

title: The Day After the Day After
description: O.K., you poor little Democrats. Stop sobbing. Lift up your little liberal heads and shout. Theres gonna be. ...

title: Motive Sought in Killing of Queens Child
description: A day after a 2-year-old boy was thrown to his death from a seventh-floor balcony in Queens, his family, neighbors and investigators struggled on Wednesday to understand what might have motivated the suspect in the case to kill him.

title: A Scale-Back Is Possible in Financial Overhaul Law
description: Only three months after the enactment in July of the Dodd-Frank Act, the financial regulation legislation that was intended as a response to the financial crisis, a section of the act has already been repealed.

title: Stately Home Awaits the Return of a Political Son
description: It is perhaps the most spectacular perk of the governors job: a 40-room Victorian mansion, with a full-time domestic staff, on six rolling acres above the Hudson River.

title: China: House Arrest For Rights Lawyer
description: A prominent rights lawyer who was released in September after years in prison remains under house arrest in his hometown in Shandong Province and is not allowed to receive visitors, Human Rights in China, an advocacy group, said Wednesday. The lawyer, Chen Guangcheng, is a vocal critic of government policies, especially of forced sterilizations or abortions by local officials trying to enforce adherence to the one-child policy. Mr. Chen was held under house arrest for one year starting in 2005, then was imprisoned for four years on criminal convictions. Human Rights in China said no one, not even Mr. Chens mother, had been allowed to visit Mr. Chen, who is blind, or his wife, Yuan Weijing, since early October.

title: After 52 Years of Waiting, One Delirious Day
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The mayor quoted Jerry Garcia, and one player pulled underwear out of his pants and held it up before 100,000 people. Another player referred to a ballot proposition to legalize marijuana as spectators with orange wigs and provocative signs cheered, snapped photos and blew kisses at their heroes.

title: You Want a Toy With That?
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Lost in the nationwide electoral tumult Tuesday was another important vote, this one by the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, which took on one of the great (tasting) issues of our day: the Happy Meal.

title: Mr. Obama, Its Time for Some Poetry
description: On my blog, a Times reader named Eddie asked about President Obama: Where is the man I voted for?

title: Republican House Could Re-energize Trade Talks
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama may find a rare opening for possible bipartisan cooperation, with a Republican House helping to re-energize American efforts to reduce trade barriers.

title: Cuomos Transition Is Already Well Under Way
description: Thousands of rsums to shuffle through. An inauguration speech to draft. A senior staff to assemble. And perhaps most important of all, decisions about who gets which office.

title: Impropriety Is Alleged at City Transit Union
description: Transport Workers Union Local 100, the influential labor group that represents many of New York Citys subway and bus workers, is no stranger to squabbles. Years of in-house clashes and strife prompted its current president to run on a Take Back Our Union platform when he was elected last year.

title: A Cuomo Heads Back to the Executive Mansion
description: The governors residence at 138 Eagle Street in Albany is rich in family memories for Andrew M. Cuomo, the governor-elect.

title: Focus Changes for Louisiana in Oil Cleanup
description: Louisiana is scaling back and altering a project to construct sand berms along its coast to block and capture oil from the BP spill, the states governor, Bobby Jindal, said this week.

title: To Save Money, Save the Health Care Act
description: In the name of fiscal probity, the incoming Republican leadership in Congress has committed to doing whatever it takes to stop the health care reform act from taking effect. Yet many of the provisions that politicians have been taking aim at are the ones that save money  like those that reduce excessive provider payments and create new institutions to curb cost growth.

title: Drugs Seized in Tunnel Near Border
description: LOS ANGELES  A drug-smuggling tunnel and approximately 30 tons of marijuana were discovered early Wednesday in the Otay Mesa section of San Diego, said officials from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the United States Drug Enforcement Administration.

title: Sorting Out the Election
description: Tuesdays election was indeed a shellacking for the Democrats, as President Obama admitted after a long night of bad news. It was hardly an order from the American people to discard the progress of the last two years and start over again.

title: The Beer Summit Catches On in Illinois
description: CHICAGO  Has the beer summit become the go-to reconciliation stunt of modern politics? The awkward meeting between Illinois Senator-elect Mark Steven Kirk, a Republican, and his defeated rival, Alexi Giannoulias, the state treasurer and a Democrat, over two brews in a dive bar here on Wednesday night certainly suggests so.

title: After New York Losses, Head of State G.O.P. Is Under Fire
description: A day after a disastrous defeat in statewide races despite huge gains for their party across the country, the soul-searching among New York State Republican officials quickly turned to recriminations  and, from several corners, calls for the resignation of the state Republican chairman, Edward F. Cox.

title: Rocky, Bullwinkle and My Dad
description: To the Editor:

title: Hopeful in 3 Tight Races, G.O.P. Is on Cusp of Control of New York Senate
description: While the 2010 election was largely disappointing for New York Republicans, there was a silver lining.

title: To the Left, to the Left. No, to the Right.
description: Mr. Wan is my mover.

title: Did Polls Underestimate Democrats Latino Vote?
description: The two Senate races where the actual winner was different from the leader in our polling-based projections were Colorado and Nevada (its also probable that well miss Lisa Murkowskis victory in Alaska once all her write-in votes are  eventually  counted).

title: In Rubio, Some See Rise of Great Right Hope
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  For many Tea Party conservatives, Hispanics, and young Americans frustrated with the national debt that baby boomers have saddled on their future, Marco Rubios victory in the Florida Senate race gave them an extra reason to celebrate.

title: Meanwhile, in Albany
description: As he celebrated winning New Yorks governorship with 62 percent of the vote, Attorney General Andrew Cuomo said New Yorkers sent him a mandate to clean up Albany. The problem is that New Yorkers, who complain a lot about Albany, also basically re-elected the whole bumbling, fumbling, corrupt Legislature.

title: New Energy Outfoxes Old in California
description: There are several ways to look at Tuesdays overwhelming endorsement by Californias voters of the states global warming law: as a vote for clean energy over dirty, as a rebuke to carpetbaggers, as proof that good things can happen when a political leader  in this case, Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger  leads.

title: Royal Family Fight Heads to a New York Courtroom
description: Family disputes over money are almost always unpleasant and difficult to untangle. When such a dispute involves a family that rules a small country and a fortune that amounts to tens of billions of dollars, the complications multiply.

title: Halloweens Afterlife
description: Its a few days after the een of Oct. 31, and the trick-or-treaters have packed away their costumes and divided up their loot. But along one of the citys streets (and we suspect many) the stoops are still in full regalia, and theyll remain that way for a while longer.

title: From Brooklyn to Beijing, and Into a Caldron
description: BEIJING  China had captivated the imagination of Paul Cabo for as long as he could remember. Maybe it started with the documentaries he saw as a child about the Great Wall. Or his desire to understand his recently immigrated Chinese classmates at Abraham Lincoln High School in Coney Island. Or maybe it was kung fu movies.

title: Andy Irons, Surf Champion, Is Dead at 32
description: Andy Irons, a three-time world surfing champion from Hawaii whose progressive wave riding and intense rivalry with Kelly Slater invigorated the sports competitive scene, died Tuesday in a Dallas hotel room while traveling home to Kauai. He was 32.

title: Rejecting Bid Sends Bad Signal
description: Canada may have just shot itself in the foot. The countrys government said that BHPs $39 billion takeover bid for the Potash Corporation provided no net benefit to the nation.

title: Lost Notes Will Linger as Footsteps Fall
description: There was a death in the family.

title: For N.F.L. Players, Another Risk: Heart Disease
description: PHILADELPHIA  Eighteen years after his last football game, Brad Quast has a stack of medical records describing the devastating effects of a brief career of very hard knocks: badly injured knees, the remnants of a serious neck injury sustained while playing in college and enough concussive damage to have caused short-term memory loss.

title: Bloggingheads: Can Obama Turn It Around?
description: Daniel Drezner of Tufts University and Megan McArdle of The Atlantic debate Obama's chances of reelection.

title: Thursday: Office Device
description: After finishing todays puzzle, I was ready to pull out my hole punch and turn the grid into a piece of Swiss cheese. The problem is, hole punches dont have much of a reach, so I had to content myself with the holes Id drawn in nine of the squares.

title: Keep It Clean
description: Im noticing a rising number of comments containing obscenities  usually no more than most of us use in conversation, but this isnt ordinary conversation, its the !@#% New York Times, and there are rules. Your perfectly reasonable comment will get deleted if it uses indecorous language.

title: Word-Woozy Roundelay in Average Town Ruled by Singular Sadness
description: The strange beauty of life and its sometimes unbearable weight are both considered with a screwball lyricism in Will Enos new play Middletown, which opened Wednesday night at the Vineyard Theater in a pitch-perfect production directed by Ken Rus Schmoll. In this delicate, moving and wry amble along the collective road to nowhere, the folks are friendly, and the view of star-dappled skies and modest homes is familiar and comforting.

title: The Family That Votes Together ...
description: More disappointment is in store for Democrats in mourning who might hope that That Hopey Changey Thing, a new play at the Public Theater written and directed by Richard Nelson, would provide the solace of a taunting attack on the rise of Sarah Palin. They will have to search for the comforts of aggrieved rhetoric from the usual providers on cable television.

title: Lottery Numbers
Got Us To The Greeks
description: We just saw An Iliad at McCarter. Fine show. But I am feeling this strange desire to slay my enemies, then throw them on a funeral pyre.

title: The Fed Discusses the Rationale for Its Securities Action
description: The following is the full text of the statement released Wednesday by the Federal Reserve:

title: Organizers Need Endurance in Recruiting Between Races
description: After chasing the worlds fastest marathon runner for the better part of the last decade  at races, at his home and in New York  Mary Wittenberg, the president of New York Road Runners, finally caught up to Haile Gebrselassie in southern Ethiopia.

title: Genentech Offers Secret Rebates for Eye Drug
description: Genentech has begun offering secret rebates to eye doctors as an apparent inducement to get them to use more of the companys expensive drug Lucentis rather than a less costly alternative.

title: Keeper of Giants Bats and of Teams History
description: SAN FRANCISCO  He has cleaned Willie Mayss spikes, ordered bats for Barry Bonds, rubbed baseballs for Juan Marichal, and this week had Champagne poured on him by Matt Cain. If anyone embodies the 52-year endurance test the San Francisco Giants underwent to reach baseballs summit, it is Mike Murphy.

title: A Possible Issue: Days Off for Jeter
description: Only four shortstops started at least 150 games last season. Derek Jeter, who turned 36 in June, was one of them. The next oldest, at 33, was Alex Gonzalez of Atlanta. As the Yankees embark on a fascinating and potentially uncomfortable set of negotiations with Jeter to decide what could be his final contract, many numbers  from the 64-point drop in his batting average this past season to the 74 hits he needs for 3,000 for his career  will be discussed.

title: Next Stop on Mosss National Tour: Tennessee
description: Randy Moss will go to the Hall of Fame some day. But on Wednesday, only one team wanted him.

title: Foreclosure Investigation by States to Stay on Track
description: Though some of the players will change, the coordinated effort by attorneys general across the country to investigate  and ultimately reshape  foreclosure procedures is not expected to lose momentum because of Tuesdays election.

title: At Breeders Cup, a Volatile Mix of Speed and Drugs
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.

title: Russia: Banker Blames Rival For Raid
description: The billionaire banker Aleksandr Y. Lebedev said Wednesday that he believed that a rival paid the police to carry out a raid on his Moscow bank headquarters in hopes that suddenly our clients would run away. In an interview with Kommersant FM, a radio station, Mr. Lebedev said that some rich and corrupted figure planned the raid on his company, in which masked men with automatic weapons swarmed into his office on Tuesday and searched for evidence in a criminal case. Mr. Lebedev, a former lieutenant colonel in the K.G.B., has dabbled in politics over the years and owns an opposition newspaper, Novaya Gazeta, that is harshly critical of the government. His remarks suggest, however, that he does not see the raid as having been politically motivated.

title: Italy: Police Strike at Crime Families
description: The police seized assets worth $561 million and arrested 47 people, including Sicilian businessmen, politicians and public officials, in an overnight anti-Mafia raid on Wednesday in Sicily and in several other regions, including Lazio, Tuscany, Emilia Romagna and Friuli Venezia Giulia. The arrests were based on four years of investigations into three Mafia families in the Catania area, in eastern Sicily, a police statement said. Separately, the police arrested 50 people accused of having links to the Camorra, a Naples-area crime group, including four municipal police officers, and seized $84 million in assets.

title: Decisive Gains at State Level Could Give Republicans a Boost for Years
description: The battle for the nations statehouses drew far less attention this year than the fight for Congress, but the Republican surge at the state level could have a longer-lasting impact than the one in Washington.

title: Outside Groups on the Right Flexed Muscles
description: On the way to winning back the majority in the House on Tuesday, Republican challenger after Republican challenger overcame significant fund-raising gaps to beat their opponents, bolstered by a deluge of spending by independent groups.

title: Boehner Becomes the Lead Character as Roles Are Reversed in the Capitol
description: WASHINGTON  The first sign of the new pecking order on Capitol Hill was the pack of cameramen jammed inside Representative John A. Boehners suite early Wednesday morning. As the Republican leader in a House run firmly by Democrats, Mr. Boehner had sometimes had trouble making his voice heard.

title: Election Night Live | Opinion 6:45pm ET
description: The Times's David Shipley and Bob Herbert discuss economic inequality.

title: Democrat Wins Oregon Governor Race
description: One day after a heated election that was initially considered too close to call, John Kitzhaber became the new governor of Oregon when his Republican opponent announced he was conceding.

title: Clyde King, Who Found Niche as Steinbrenners Troubleshooter, Is Dead at 86
description: Clyde King, who spent six decades in baseball as a player, coach, manager, scout and executive, notably as a versatile cog in the ever-shifting personnel machinations of George Steinbrenner, principal owner of the Yankees, died on Tuesday in Goldsboro, N.C. He was 86.

title: Modern Masters Lead to Records at Christies
description: The global taste for modern masters helped the market for Impressionist and modern art continue its upward climb at Christies on Wednesday night, where record prices were reached for artists like Matisse and Gris.

title: The 2010 Republican Comeback: How It Developed
description: On Election Night, the Republican party nearly succeeded in its goal to capture control of Congress only two years after a Democratic sweep.

title: Democrats Outrun by a 2-Year G.O.P. Comeback Plan
description: The PowerPoint slides presented to House Republicans in January 2009 seemed incongruously optimistic at a time when the very word hope belonged to the newly ascendant Democrats and their incoming president, Barack Obama.

title: Asian Markets See Slight Gains After Fed Move
description: HONG KONG  Asian stock markets took the details of a much-anticipated asset-purchase program by the Federal Reserve in stride on Thursday, with gains that were for the most part subdued, just as they were on Wall Street.

title: J.F.K. Cargo Facility Evacuated Briefly
description: A cargo area at Kennedy International Airport was briefly evacuated on Wednesday evening when a suspicious package from Yemen was discovered, the authorities said.

title: New Faces in Congress
description: Some of the new  and newly-powerful  faces headed to Washington, including those who won big and others who just squeaked by.

title: City Gives Out Fewer As in High School Reviews
description: New York City high schools fared slightly worse on their annual A through F report cards this year, with a small decline in the number of schools receiving As and a rise in the number of schools earning Ds or Fs, city officials said Wednesday.

title: Google and VivaKi Extend Partnership
description: On Thursday, Google and VivaKi, a digital agency that is part of the Publicis Groupe, will announce a two-year renewal of their 2008 partnership that will incorporate a new platform for buying video and mobile display ads in the United States and Europe. The platform, an extension of the VivaKi Nerve Center trading desk, or the Audience on Demand product, would allow companies to bid on mobile and video display advertising space in real time on ad exchanges, including Googles DoubleClick exchange.

title: Born to Run the Marathon?
description: Even though Im running better and farther now than I did in my 20s and have been researching, writing and talking about almost nothing but running, Ive stayed away from the marathon. The distance wasnt the problem. It was the event itself that bugged me.

title: Kinect Pushes Users Into a Sweaty New Dimension
description: With the money Microsoft has spent on failed efforts to design hardware, you could finance a trip to Mars.

title: A Home System Leaves Hand Controls in the Dust
description: I had just started trying Microsofts new Kinect system for the Xbox 360 the other day when my friend Lee knocked on my front door.

title: AT&Ts Bet on Health Technology
description: The new Republican majority in the House has vowed to undo vast swaths of the Obama administrations agenda for health care reform. But analysts predict that technology projects will be mostly off limits.

title: Location Services Have Not Caught On, Report Says
description: Technology companies, venture capitalists and retailers have expressed no small amount of enthusiasm for location-based Web services, which allow users to check into locations in order to connect with friends or cash in on special offers from businesses.

title: Corrections
description: NEW YORK

title: Word of the Day | atavism
description: atavism \a-t-vi-zm\ noun

title: Health Care Vote Only a Part of Democrats Vulnerability
description: ATLANTA  In the end, it may have mattered less whether vulnerable Democratic incumbents voted for or against the health care law than that they simply had a D by their names.

title: New Faces in Congress
description: Some new  and newly powerful  faces are headed to Washington, including those who won big and others who just squeaked by.

title: Joseph Gavin, Who Helped Put First Man on Moon, Dies at 90
description: Joseph G. Gavin Jr., who rode herd over the immensely complex design, construction and testing of the first manned vehicle to land on the moon  a task that included anticipating 400 different landing surfaces, from ice to boulders to dust to potholes  died on Saturday in Amherst, Mass. He was 90.

title: Big Margin for Cuomo, but Short of Historic
description: Andrew M. Cuomos victory was one of the more lopsided wins that any candidate for New York governor has recorded.

title: A 25-Year Run of Service Ends, Sunk by a Wave of Discontent
description: MOOSIC, Pa.

title: Japanese Runner Looks to Make Mark in New York
description: Professional Japanese runners have raced sporadically in the New York City Marathon, but the self-proclaimed marathon pioneer Arata Fujiwara hopes to help change that. Fujiwara, whose 2:08:40 at the 2008 Tokyo Marathon is second fastest among active Japanese marathoners, will make his New York debut Sunday.

title: News Quiz | November 4, 2010
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Restaurants in the Caribbean From World-Renowned Chefs
description: THE club sandwiches and shrimp cocktails that once defined resort cuisine are undergoing a transformation, as several high-profile chefs have opened Caribbean outposts of their top-shelf franchises. And though the chefs face notable challenges  thanks, in part, to geography and limited infrastructure  the ventures offer a way for them to infuse their brands with a tropical appeal.

title: 36 Hours in St. Martin/St. Maarten
description: AMONG the accolades awarded to Caribbean islands (most beautiful beach, easiest on the budget, most relaxing), the award for most densely developed probably goes to St. Martin/St. Maarten  the half-Dutch, half-French island in the West Indies. That is not to say the islands natural beauty is ruined. It remains a stunningly picturesque place with some of the Caribbeans most arresting scenery (here it could win a prize, too). But all that development  boutique hotels, casinos, marinas, high-rise resorts  means visitors are never short on options. And thanks to a seemingly endless construction boom, those options keep multiplying.

title: 6 Caribbean Beaches to See Before You Die
description: CARIBBEAN beach vacations sometimes get a bad rap. Too much monotony, the naysayers grumble. The only thing to do is lie on the beach, and they all look the same. But the Caribbean Sea  with islands that are flat, mountainous, tiny and vast  is specked with beaches that defy tropical conventions. There are beaches with gray sand, beaches with pink sand, those that seem to go on forever without any sign of human life, and others that hum with activity.

title: My Own Private (Rental) Island, in the Bahamas
description: SO the idea was this: Six days with my wife on an uninhabited, mostly unpowered Bahamian island.

title: 6 Action Adventures in the Caribbean
description: WHEN it comes to a Caribbean vacation, the idea of an extreme activity takes on a new meaning. Would it be taking a walk on the beach? Possibly. Eating lunch delivered poolside? Closer. A marathon towel-napping session? Definitely.

title: In the Caribbean, a Wave of New Resorts Offers a Range of Enticements
description: A WAVE of new hotels and resorts usually open their doors during high season in the islands. And despite the economic stasis, this year is no exception. There is, however, one discernible difference: theyre highlighting experience along with escape. Whether high-end or mid-range, the most interesting newcomers are underscoring their location through cuisine, cultural events, design or programs.

title: 7 Caribbean Resorts That Go All Out for Families
description: CLOSE your eyes and imagine a Caribbean paradise: throngs of baby sitters minding tots around the raucous swimming pool, chicken fingers on every menu and Big Bird plodding cheerfully along the beach, the white sand drifting across the Muppets yellow feathers.

title: Should Stores Sell Violent Video Games to Minors?
description: The Supreme Court is currently debating this question and trying to determine what the drafters of the Bill of Rights would have made of an extremely violent game like Postal 2. What do you think about this? How violent, deviant, offensive, or morbid should a game have to be to make it unsuitable for people under 18? How would you draw the line? And how do you think violent video games affect young people in general? Why?

Soon after, he moved onto reselling artworks  a trade he was so good at he was soon nicknamed Go Go. Today, he is one of the worlds best known gallerists, with nine branded spaces, including one in Athens and two in London, that specialize in contemporary artists ranging from Pablo Picasso to Damien Hirst and Cindy Sherman.

title: Do Employees Still Feel Lucky to Have Jobs?
description: It has now been almost three years since the economy entered the Great Recession and two years since it took the nosedive in the fall of 2008. Though the economists say the recession was over months ago, the small-business owners I talk to have not seen sales rebound to where they were. Some businesses havent rebounded at all. I have been in business for more than 30 years, and I have never seen anything like this. Its like a normal recession but with an extra year or two thrown in. Yes, things have stabilized, and in some cases they have gotten better. On the human side, things are precarious.

title: The Other Oil Cleanup
description: It was a little past 9 on a scorching July morning in South Texas, and Tony Buzbee was gunning down the Gulf Freeway outside Houston in his cherry red Ferrari 612 Scaglietti (license plate BUZB 8) on his way to a court hearing in Galveston. Buzbees right hand was occupied with one of his ever-present La Gloria Cubana cigars, while his left stayed in intermittent contact with the wheel as he recounted how he destroyed an insurance companys expert witness in a recent deposition. So total was the demolition, in Buzbees telling, that the witness retired on the spot from any future trial work. I basically made him admit that his entire compensation model was fouled up, Buzbee said with undisguised relish, as well as the blunt profanity that is a hallmark of his conversations.

It was certainly an attractive piece of design. Early models sported a super-techy grill designed by the companys chief creative officer, Yves Bhar, and later models included one that was just the shade of red to match my hair. But I could never get past the fact that I didnt really mind talking on a phone, no matter how many bells and whistles the Jawbone could offer.

title: Oscar Catches Up With Uncle Eli
description: THERES something I want to show you, Eli Wallach says, ushering me into his apartment on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. On this occasion what he has in mind is a drawing by Al Hirschfeld, one of two that hang prominently in the front hall: Thats Annie and me, on our 50th anniversary. Anyone with a memory of New York theater  or, for that matter, of the Sunday Arts & Leisure section of this newspaper  extending back a few decades would surely recognize Hirschfelds affectionate likeness of Mr. Wallach and Anne Jackson, his frequent co-star and also his wife of 62 years. Never one to miss a cue, the real-life Ms. Jackson steps forward to accept a modest bouquet of purple irises, rewarding the bearer with kisses and a version of the incandescent smile so brilliantly captured and caricatured by Hirschfelds pen.

Thats another sign that the economy is a long way from any kind of worrisome inflation, as I argued in a column today.

We did, however, forget them until ten or so days later  and they were still viable. More than viable, in fact: they were bright and crisp.

description: Some highlights from the Specialty Equipment Manufacturers Association show in Las Vegas.

title: Eye-Popping
description: The artist Tauba Auerbach deals with perception and illusion, finding moments of ambiguity between two dimensions and three. (Think of her trompe loeil folded canvases, at this years Whitney Biennial.) Which is why, presumably, she fell so hard for pop-up books. When a page closes, you see an object kind of smush, and in that moment, its in a liminal state not unlike the Fold paintings, she says. Auerbach began collecting classic pop-ups like Alphabeta Concertina and Andy Warhols Index (Book) last year, and also began the process of making her own. To create [2,3]  which is being introduced this weekend by Printed Matter at the NY Art Book Fair  she spent months teaching herself how to construct complex geometric shapes from strips of paper, then several more creating templates and instructional videos so that the printer could reproduce them. Among the pieces are Cubearc (above), a delicate Mbius-like curl and Ziggurat: 10 nested tiers that telescope out to 18 inches high. I tried things that someone who had experience probably would have shied away from, says Auerbach, who insists that her goal wasnt to make the most complicated thing possible. It was just to make something beautiful and uncanny happen.

title: Life Spans of the Elderly
description: Elderly Americans are more likely to have medical problems than elderly Britons, but once they turn 70, older Americans live longer, international researchers said Thursday.

title: CT Scans Cut Lung Cancer Deaths, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Annual CT scans of current and former heavy smokers reduced their risk of death from lung cancer by 20 percent, a huge government-financed study has found. Even more surprising, the scans seem to reduce the risks of death from other causes as well, suggesting that the scans could be catching other illnesses.

title: Spaghetti, the No. 8 and Green Underwear: Rituals to Run With
description: When the cannons go off on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge on Sunday, Mary Darling will savor an instant of peace before the adrenaline charges through her. She knows that her best friends father has just lit a candle  timed precisely for her start of the New York City Marathon  at St. Christophers Church in Baldwin, N.Y., just as he does for every marathon she runs.

title: Abroad, Fear That Midterm Result May Turn U.S. Inward
description: PARIS  Just two years ago, the election of President Obama resonated far beyond American shores, inspiring euphoric assessments in Europe in particular that American politics had embarked on new and enduring change after years of the Bush administration. It took the midterm elections this week to finally persuade some among Mr. Obamas global fan club to think otherwise.

title: Obama Invites Republican Leaders to Dinner
description: In the aftermath of this weeks electoral shellacking, President Obama on Thursday invited Congressional leaders to literally break bread later this month at a dinner at the White House as he tries to adjust to a new political order with Republicans ascendant.

title: Discussing Family Money Without the Family Drama

Many parents remain reluctant to talk about how much money they plan to leave their children, and that can lead to conflict among siblings and hurt feelings long after the parents are gone.
