description: To the Editor:

title: Hevesi Adviser in Pension Scandal Makes Deal to Plead Guilty to Felony
description: Hank Morris, a onetime political adviser to Alan G. Hevesi, the former state comptroller, on Thursday became the latest figure in the corruption scandal involving the New York pension fund to agree to plead guilty.

title: Parking Rules
description: On Friday, because of Diwali, the Hindu festival

title: BofA Rejects Calls to Buy Back Mortgages
description: Bank of America on Thursday rebuffed claims by a lawyer for several big investors, including the Federal Reserve Bank of New York and Pimco, that it should buy back troubled mortgages because the loans were made improperly, The New York Times reports.

title: A Loss, and a Farewell, for the Red Bulls
description: Harrison, N.J.

title: Facing New Crisis, Haitians Prove Skeptical
description: CORAIL, Haiti  Hours before the first raindrops and stiff winds of Tropical Storm Tomas arrived Thursday night, a group of aid workers bent on evacuating earthquake survivors from a tent camp here roared away in vans empty-handed.

title: Rangers Look for Revenge but Dont Find It Against the Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA  The game was hyped as the rematch of last Aprils breathless season finale, when the Flyers beat the Rangers in a shootout to win a playoff spot and send the Rangers home.

title: With Homegrown Talent, a Rising Power on Long Island
description: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y.  After Hofstras womens soccer team lost, badly, in its season opener, then fashioned the longest winning streak in the country, the next game it plays could still be its last of the year. Possible, but not likely.

title: Time Running Out for Mets on Takahashi
description: The chances of Hisanori Takahashi remaining with the Mets are dwindling by the hour as the deadline to re-sign him approaches. With no significant progress in contract talks, it appears he will leave the Mets. The Mets are not willing to guarantee a two-year contract for Takahashi, the versatile Japanese left-hander who wants at least that to remain with the team.

title: For Some Bushmen, a Homeland Worth the Fight
description: CENTRAL KALAHARI GAME RESERVE, Botswana  They were on the move beneath an unyielding sun, and for a while their approaching shapes seemed just another part of the desert, their tattered clothes bleached like the thorny scrub around them. These weary Bushmen  four men, three women and an infant  were nearing the end of a two-day journey, walking their way toward water.

title: Are Polar Bears More than Threatened?
description: 10:43 p.m. | Updated The Center for Biological Diversity is known for creative public relations stunts, like deploying one of its lawyers in a polar bear suit at climate talks in Copenhagen last December:

title: Re-elected Texas Governor Sounding Like a Candidate
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Gov. Rick Perry says he has no interest in running for president, but one would never know it by watching him this week.

title: Bushmen Resettle on Outskirts of Reserve
description: Since the 1980s, Botswana has both coaxed and hounded the Bushmen to leave the Central Kalahari Game Reserve, intending to restrict the area to what its name implies: a wildlife refuge empty of human residents.

title: A Democrat Is the Winner in Washington
description: Senator Patty Murray of Washington State has won a fourth term, narrowly defeating her Republican challenger Dino Rossi, who conceded Thursday afternoon.

title: Rasmussen Polls Were Biased and Inaccurate; Quinnipiac, SurveyUSA Performed Strongly
description: Every election cycle has its winners and losers: not just the among the candidates, but also the pollsters.

title: Wall Street Ends the Week Higher
description: Stocks rose on Friday as a better-than-expected jobs report helped the market extend robust gains of the day before, keeping the major indexes at their highest levels for at least a year.

title: Learning in Dorm, Because Class Is on the Web
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  Like most other undergraduates, Anish Patel likes to sleep in. Even though his Principles of Microeconomics class at 9:35 a.m. is just a five-minute stroll from his dorm, he would rather flip open his laptop in his room to watch the lecture, streamed live over the campus network.

title: The Crisis in Public Housing
description: After nearly two decades of weak financing from Congress, a large number of the public housing developments that shelter 2.3 million of the nations poorest, most vulnerable people are falling apart.

title: Grim Lesson of Bomb Plot
description: To the Editor:

title: Midwest at Dusk
description: If Balzac were alive today, he would plant himself in that region of America that starts in central New York and Pennsylvania and then stretches out through Ohio and Indiana before spreading out to include Wisconsin and Arkansas. Hed plant himself in the working-class families in this area.

title: Last Chance for a Pontiac
description: To the Editor:

title: Medicare and the Republicans
description: An overwhelming majority of older voters chose Republican Congressional candidates in Tuesdays election. They were propelled in large part, we suspect, by distorted and inflammatory attack ads claiming that President Obamas health care reforms would gut their Medicare coverage and implying that a Republican-controlled Congress would somehow rescue them.

title: A Crack in the Wall
description: When the Supreme Court took up a case about a school choice program in Arizona this week, Justice Elena Kagan said she had been puzzling and puzzling over it. Why, she asked the states lawyer, instead of providing families with vouchers, is Arizonas program so much more complicated and complex and unusual?

title: Campaign Money to Burn
description: After Tuesdays vote, there is no limit to the ambitions of stealth political groups bankrolled by anonymous check writers. Two of the flushest pro-Republican operations, American Crossroads and Crossroads GPS, plan to extend their campaigning into the lame-duck session of Congress with waves of misinformation about tax and immigration issues.

title: Asteroids and Global Warming
description: To the Editor:

title: The Focus Hocus-Pocus
description: Democrats, declared Evan Bayh in an Op-Ed article on Wednesday in The Times, overreached by focusing on health care rather than job creation during a severe recession. Many others have been saying the same thing: the notion that the Obama administration erred by not focusing on the economy is hardening into conventional wisdom.

title: A Firing at NPR: Issues of Fairness and Financing
description: To the Editor:

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,348 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American this week:

title: A View From Myanmar as Election Nears
description: For a country that has been under some form of military government since its creation in 1962, Sundays elections could engender change, even if that change occurs on the juntas terms.

title: Chronicles Coverage of Sit/Lie Prompts a Question
description: Scott James is a columnist for The Bay Citizen

title: Photo Replay: Nov. 4
description: The day in sports, from soccer to golf.

title: California: Transgender Candidate Is New Judge
description: Voters in the San Francisco Bay Area elected the first transgender trial judge in the country on Tuesday. Victoria Kolakowski, a lawyer who underwent gender reassignment surgery more than two decades ago, won the race for Superior Court judge in Alameda County with more than 50 percent of the vote.

title: California: Competency Hearing Set In Kidnap Trial
description: A judge in the trial of Philip and Nancy Garrido, accused of kidnapping Jaycee Dugard in 1991 and holding her for 18 years, has set a tentative date in March for a mental competency hearing for Mr. Garrido. Judge Douglas Phimister said that would allow time for court-appointed psychiatrists to evaluate Mr. Garrido. The Garridos were arrested in 2009 at their home outside Antioch, Calif., where Mr. Garrido is accused of holding Ms. Dugard and two children he fathered by her. She was 11 at the time of her kidnapping. Several news organizations have sought to have transcripts of Ms. Dugards grand jury testimony released. Stephen A. Tapson, a lawyer for Ms. Garrido, objects to releasing them, saying they described a tale of woe and misfortune that would prejudice a jury. This stuff is evil, Mr. Tapson said.

title: Displaying Shooting Touch, Knicks Return to Prime Time
description: CHICAGO  Three years ago, the Knicks wandered onto a national television broadcast and so humiliated themselves that their own coach declared, Were not ready for prime time.

title: A Simpler Label For Not-So-Secret Information
description: President Obama on Thursday rolled back a proliferating array of policies by which federal agencies had kept unclassified information from the public, issuing an executive order intended to create a uniform way of handling such information. Mr. Obamas order requires agencies to use only one term  Controlled Unclassified Information, or CUI  when stamping certain documents that officials believe should be safeguarded but that are not delicate enough to warrant being classified. That label would replace almost 120 markings that various agencies had developed to protect information.

title: Glen Little, Better Known as Frosty the Clown, Dies at 84
description: Glen Little, better known as Frosty the Clown, who performed at the White House and was a teacher and mentor to a generation of clowns with the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus, died on Oct. 26 in Kimberly, Idaho, near his home in Burley. He was 84.

title: Student Aid at For-Profit School Will Be Reviewed
description: Apollo Group Inc. announced Thursday that next month the Department of Education would review its University of Phoenix, the nations largest for-profit college. The review will look at how Phoenix, which took in $1 billion in Pell grants last year, has handled federal student aid it has received since the 2009-2010 academic year. Last month, in a move that depressed the stock values of the for-profit higher education sector, Phoenix withdrew its forecast for fiscal 2011, saying it expected a decline in new enrollments.

title: New York Teams Believe Improvement Begins With Recruiting
description: Last year, college basketball in the New York metro area was in the midst of a drought that threatened a record. That mark of four years without a local team in the N.C.A.A. tournament has since been tied, and this season, there is a new crop of coaches, all of whom are trying to figure out how the drought came about and how it might end.

title: Smart-Growth Policy Splits Environmentalists
description: Most people would assume that environmentalists would rather protect tall trees than tall buildings.

title: Defeat of Proposition B Cements Labors Power
description: The scene at Hi Dive, a bar on the Embarcadero tucked under the Bay Bridge, was a merry one late Tuesday night.

title: After a Study, Healthy Changes Block by Block
description: Seven years ago, Leony Caldern felt much older than her 30 years. My joints hurt so much, it was hard to go up stairs, Ms. Caldern said last week at her office at the Greater Humboldt Park Community Diabetes Empowerment Center. Dangerously overweight, she stopped menstruating, had high cholesterol and was pre-diabetic. She knew something had to be done.

title: A Comet Closeup
description: Heres a closeup of Comet Hartley 2, which was photographed during a flyby by the EPOXI mission. There are jets of gas spewing from the sun-heated surfaces of the object. I post it here simply for the sake of its stunning, stark beauty (Credit: NASA/JPL, CalTech/UMD):

title: Sitting Out the Chance to Exercise a Freedom
description: James Warren is a columnist for the Chicago News Cooperative

title: A Concession Talk Still to Come
description: He tried to make the call the night of the election, but he could not get through.

title: Hard Work and Money Helped State Democrats Resist G.O.P. Tide
description: Campaigning in the crowded Schaumburg Metra station before the election this week, Michael Noland, a Democratic state senator in one of the states most hotly contested races, lowered his voice to make what he described as a confession: I voted for Ronald Reagan.

title: Rick Perry, Master of the Friendly Attack
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column.

title: More High School Students Acquire Online Credits
description: Brett Rusnock can follow his students every move on his laptop: how much time they spend on computers each day at Waltrip High School in Houston, their scores on quizzes and when they stop working. He even gets e-mail alerts when they toil at home into the wee hours. I can play Big Brother a little bit with this, Mr. Rusnock said.

title: Bernanke Fearing Fate of Japan, Not Greece
description: WASHINGTON  By placing a $600 billion bet on the Federal Reserves ability to encourage the recovery, Ben S. Bernanke is gingerly trying to avoid the mistakes of Japan, where deflation has stymied growth. But the antideficit Republicans who seized control of the House on Tuesday draw cautionary lessons from a different country: debt-stricken Greece.

title: Debra Winger Drops Back In
description: When Debra Winger, the actor who is now as famous for walking away from her chosen profession as for excelling within it, first met with the producers of HBOs psychotherapy drama In Treatment, it was because they were hoping to entice her to take on the role of Frances, a complicated, unhappy and sometimes evasive leading lady whom Winger wryly describes as just another in a long line of women I hope never to become. Early meetings between actresses and producers are an odd Hollywood ritual. Theyre not quite mating dances; theyre more like strenuously casual preinterviews for a first date, full of mutual courtesies designed to prevent any hurt feelings. Accordingly, Winger arrived prepared  not only with a list of questions and ideas about the role, but also with the names of several other performers the producers might want to pursue instead of her if she wasnt the right fit. I had in my head the names of five other actresses, she said, all of whom I thought would, in a way, be better. Its pretty amazing whos out there, not working.

title: Word of the Day | gruff
description: gruff \grf\ adjective

title: Costly Spider-Man Cant Get Off the Ground
description: Its supposed to be the biggest, costliest, splashiest show of the Broadway season, but so far its just the most troubled. Executives with Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark said Thursday that the opening of the oft-delayed, $60 million musical would be set back once again, this time by three weeks, meaning it will miss lucrative Thanksgiving week, forgo an attention-getting bow over Christmas, and open during the box office doldrums of January.

title: BNP Paribas Profit Beats Expectations
description: BNP Paribas, the large French bank, reported on Thursday a profit for the third quarter that easily topped expectations, as strong growth in its consumer banking and investment management businesses offset a decline in commercial and investment banking, David Jolly reports in The New York Times.

title: In a Cost Per Vote Analysis, Some Candidates Did Not Get What They Paid For
description: Your attention is expensive. Gov. Rick Perrys campaign spent $14.58 for every vote he received in the general election. Democrat Bill White spent $11.76. And those were the efficient contests.

description: HARRISON, N.J.  Within minutes of the opening whistle, a game most expected would resemble a tactical chess match instead revealed itself as a free-swinging heavyweight bout.

title: Live vs. Distance Learning: Measuring the Differences
description: The educational value of online courses has been debated for years, based on a large but uneven body of research. An analysis of 99 studies by the federal Department of Education concluded last year that online instruction, on average, was more effective than face-to-face learning by a modest amount.

title: Passion Still Burns for New Yorks Bravest
description: Matt Longs record at the New York City Marathon prompts meager praise when measured against the elite runners. He has completed New York four times, with a personal best 3 hours 13 minutes in 2005. Long, a New York City firefighter, has competed with the citys fire department team in Mayors Cup races against its police officers, helping the firemen maintain a commanding 23-4 edge in the series.

title: Airgas and Air Products Executives Meet
description: Airgas, the industrial gas company that has been fending off a $5.5 billion hostile bid from a rival, Air Products and Chemicals, said senior executives from the two companies met on Thursday to discuss their views on Airgass valuation, Reuters reports.

description: This Saturday is expected to be the final race of Zenyatta's career.

description: Avis Budget, which recently raised about $400 million by selling notes, will require additional financing to complete the Dollar Thrifty transaction, its top executive said.

title: Wal-Mart Unit Involved in Japan Insider Trade Probe
description: Wal-Mart Stores, the worlds biggest retailer, said it was cooperating with an investigation into possible insider trading related to its takeover of the Japanese retail chain Seiyu, Reuters reports.

description: Federal regulators may get the ammunition they need to impose new market rules when they meet an advisory panel on Friday to discuss the May 6 plunge that briefly sent the equities market and related futures into a tailspin, Reuters reports.

description: Test your knowledge of history with todays question about a historical presidential race.

description: Canadas farm minister offered one reason that Canada blocked the proposed takeover of the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan on Thursday, but markets will have to wait a month for all the details to emerge, Reuters reports.

description: Todays word, in association with the brilliant Oxford English Dictionary, is

title: Despite Cadbury Bump, Kraft Misses Revenue Target
description: Kraft Foods reported weaker-than-expected quarterly revenue, after price increases taken to offset rising ingredient costs hurt sales, Reuters reports.

title: What Are Your Personal Superstitions?
description: With the New York City Marathon just two days away, runners have been revealing some of the superstitions and rituals that they believe will affect how well they will run those famous 26.2 miles. What do you think about this? Can months and months of grueling training really come down to a lit candle or a certain number appearing  or not  on a runners race bib? What superstitions do you follow, and why?

title: In Nigeria, Companies Miss Deadline for Telecom Sale
description: A group of private companies missed a deadline Thursday to provide a $750 million down payment to purchase Nigerias ailing state-run telephone company, the latest setback in efforts to privatize the firm, The Associated Press reported.

title: Coke Plans $4 Billion Debt Sale, Its Biggest Ever
description: Coca-Cola announced a $4 billion debt offering on Thursday, the biggest in its history, as the worlds top soft drink maker aims to take advantage of low borrowing rates, Reuters reports.

title: JPMorgan to Resume Foreclosures This Month
description: JPMorgan Chase expects to start refiling foreclosure documents in a couple of weeks, according to Charlie Scharf, chief executive of retail financial services, Reuters reports.

title: In Qantas Blowout, Concern for Jet Engine Maker
description: PARIS  Shares of Rolls-Royce, the British aircraft engine maker, extended their declines on Friday after the chief executive of Qantas suggested that a design flaw or manufacturing defect was the most likely explanation for a engine blow-out that forced one of the Australian carriers A380 jets to make an emergency landing in Singapore on Thursday.

title: Banks Face $31 Billion Loss on Mortgage Buybacks
description: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poors said in a report on Thursday, Reuters reports.

title: Xstrata Wins Round in Battle for Sphere Minerals
description: Sphere Minerals, an Australia-listed iron ore prospector, fended off an attempt by its biggest shareholder to derail its agreed $522 million takeover from the global miner Xstrata, Reuters reported.

title: Fed May Let Strong Banks Increase Dividends
description: The Federal Reserve is soon expected to allow some healthy banks with strong capital levels to increase dividend payments, according to people familiar with the decision, Reuters reports.

title: First Yuan Credit Default Swaps Signed
description: The first yuan-denominated credit default swaps insuring bonds and loans were signed Friday as China experiments with derivatives blamed by some European and United States officials for exacerbating the global financial crisis, Bloomberg News reports.

title: Coal Remains Top as Green Power I.P.O. Struggles
description: Waning investor interest in clean energy contrasted sharply with enthusiasm for coal on Thursday as shares in Enel Green Power fell on their debut while Coal Indias soared, Reuters reported.

title: China Police Confine Prominent Artist
description: BEIJING  A phalanx of Beijing police officers confined the prominent artist and activist Ai Weiwei to his north Beijing home on Friday, a move he suggested came at the behest of unnamed but powerful political figures in Shanghai who feared that he was about to embarrass them.

title: AMP Resumes Talks Over AXA Asia Pacific Bid

title: The Jets, the Patriots and Danny Woodheads Real Height

After the post was published, I was contacted by Chris Gittings, one of Woodheads agents, and by Stacey James, a Patriots spokesman.

title: Tip of the Week: Tidying Up Outlook-Window Clutter
description: If you spend your day replying to e-mail in Microsoft Outlook, you may find yourself with a stack of open message windows all over your screen by lunchtime. Fortunately, most recent versions of Outlook can help you keep things tidy by closing the windows for you.

title: Mail.ru, Facebook Backer, Up 41% After London I.P.O.
description: The Mail.ru Group, a Russian investor in Facebook, surged as much as 41 percent in London trading after raising $912 million in the citys biggest initial public offering since July, Bloomberg News reported.

title: Homage
description: In my recent column on Stephen Colberts coinage of truthiness, I wrote that the title of Charles Seifes new book, Proofiness, is very much a homage to Colbert. Laura Kozin e-mails: "My brain stubbed its toe on this. I thought we pronounced it an (h)omage. Did I miss a change to spoken h? Is it now a herb garden as well? Steve Penn e-mails: Your last column indicated that you pronounce homage with the h. Me too. A few years ago, on the radio, I was jolted to hear this word pronounced oh-MAZH. A real stomach-turner. Since then, I've heard this pronunciation fairly frequently on the radio and occasionally on television. Are the broadcast folks cooking up a new pronunciation, or do they intend some word other than homage?

title: One on One: Vivek Kundra, U.S. Chief Information Officer
description: Vivek Kundra is the chief information officer of the United States. His job is to help shape the use of technology in government and build tools to help the public navigate the incredible amount of data and information available.

title: Bush/Nixon
description: The early reviews of George W. Bushs memoir Decision Points are already out, even though the book is under a sales embargo until next Tuesday. If you want to read one of the books deluxe copies  the hand-numbered, hand-signed edition that comes with a slipcase, a special color photo frontispiece and a $350 price tag  youll have to wait even longer, until Nov. 30.
